SENT.plain: Dermatomyositis and antiphospholipid syndrome are rare diseases that can be associated pulmonary damage

We report a case of anti-phospholipid syndrome that presented with bilateral pulmonary embolism and subsequently developed pulmonary infiltrates in association with the characteristic muscular and cutaneous features of dermatomyositis
Histological examination of trans-bronchial biopsies revealed bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia
